title: National Accounts Manager, Key Accounts
content:
Job Summary
The National Accounts Manager is responsible for supporting the development of new and existing relationships with Key Accounts to include Broker Dealers, Banks, and RIAs, and will provide pro-active, high-end support to the National Account VP (NAVP) and Key Account Partners. 
This position reports directly to the National Account VP, and indirectly to the SVP, Financial Institutions Channel. This position will collaborate with our National Account VPs, Regional Vice Presidents, and FI Channel Leadership to uncover new distribution opportunities for F&G.
Duties and Responsibilities

Support NAVP with existing Key Accounts by providing issue resolution and specific Key Accounts requests
Manage Key Accounts Sales Reporting to NAVP and FI Channel Leadership
Manage RFP/RFI/Due Diligence process in conjunction with NAVP and F&G Retail Operations Team
Manage communications with Key Accounts under guidance of NAVP
Create quarterly reports inclusive of services/sales reports for delivery to our external partners and of reports used to analyze firms internally
Conduct in-person and virtual website demos, illustration and product training
Manage marketing materials submission, approval and retention process and engage with F&G Marketing and Key Accounts to ensure needs are met (directly or through 4U)
Leverage SalesForce to initiate and track sales campaigns, marketing initiatives and to provide sales intelligence to VPNA, RVPs, and FI Channel Management (new producers, ‘fallen angels’, MIAs)
Submit Conference Request Forms to F&G Events Team and travel to conferences as needed
Work closely with wholesaling team to determine territory needs and share Key Account data sets
Cultivate relationships with Key Account contacts and internal F&G Stakeholders.
Travel as needed to Key Account with and without NAVP (and manage smaller Key Account relationships where required).
Look for opportunities to grow F&G sales by analyzing the competitive landscape to determine which F&G products would fit best at each Key Account
Survey technology needs of each potential Key Account to ensure compatibility with F&G
Assist with onboarding and pre-launch activities for each Key Account opportunity
Meet or exceed annual sales plan across Key Accounts and the FI Channel

Experience and Education Requirements

Bachelor's degree required preferably in Business or Marketing.
Industry recognized designation preferred such as RICP, CLU, ChFC or CFP.
3+ years of key account management experience in Brokers Dealers, Banks, or RIAs
Demonstrated success in sales and/or marketing functions.
Series 6, 63 and State Insurance License

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent presentation skills
Strong project management, organization and follow up skills
Insurance industry knowledge
Ability to foster effective working relationships within the organization and with Key Accounts
Strong PC skills and familiarity with SalesForce and other Financial Services technology

Other Requirements

Perform other functions, duties and projects as assigned
Regular and punctual attendance
Demonstrated ability to work within a home office environment while virtually located
Approximately 50% travel is required


#LI-JB1
#LI-Remote
Additional Information 
Work Environments
F&G believes in an employee-centric flexible environment, which is why we offer the ability for in-office, hybrid and remote work arrangements. During the hiring process, you'll work with your leader to decide what works best for your role.
Join our employee-centric hybrid work environment: F&G Careers
About F&G
Since 1959, Fidelity & Guaranty Life Insurance Company (F&G) has offered annuity and life insurance products to those who are seeking security in retirement and protection during life’s unexpected events.
As a national Top Workplace1, an Iowa Top Workplace2 and a proud equal opportunity employer, F&G team members are empowered, collaborative, dynamic and authentic. We believe that by embracing these values, we will continue to build and strengthen the company while continuing to be a great place to work.
1Top Workplaces USA 2022 – 2023 
2Des Moines Register Top Workplaces 2018 – 2022

questions.description: Family member is defined as “spouse or significant other, child/step child, parent/step parent, sibling/step sibling, grandparent, grandchild, in-laws (father/mother, son/daughter), aunt, uncle, niece, nephew, cousin and legal guardians.”
